title: Resources help to grow farming business

tasks.task: Forming a farming partnership and managing family dynamics.
subtasks: Navigating family conflicts within a farming operation.
Expanding land holdings from 450 acres to 3,500 acres.
Dividing responsibilities among partners with different skill sets and interests.
Attending farm management meetings and reporting on performance.
Overseeing various portfolios within the farming business.

tasks.task: Transitioning family farm structure and operations.
subtasks: Addressing the challenges of combining original family farms.
Adapting to changes in family relationships due to business growth.
Implementing a structure with directors managing different aspects of the farm.
Ensuring accountability through key performance indicators (KPIs).

tasks.task: Dealing with external influences on the farm.
subtasks: Working with external partners like STA (Possibly a grain handling company).
Understanding futures and options in the agricultural market (e.g., corn, wheat, soybeans).
Managing political and regulatory aspects of farming.
